sources.title: The First Teacher
sources.description:
A screen adaptation of the story by Chingiz Aitmatov. The film is about a former Red Army soldier, a kyrgyz teacher Duishen. Without much knowledge, he captivates his students, who love him for his honesty, fairness and willingness to help everyone.

IMDB: 7,5

Year of production: 1965

Director: Mikhalkov-Konchalovsky Andrey
Scriptwriters: Aitmatov Chingiz, Dobrodeev Boris, Mikhalkov-Konchalovsky Andrey
Composer: Ovchinnikov Vyacheslav
Cameraman: Rerberg Georgy
Production designer: Romadin Mikhail

Cast: Actors: Bolot Beishenaliev, Natalya Arinbasarova, Darkul Kuyukova, Idris Nogaibaev, M. Kyshtobaev, Kirey Zharkimbaev, Sovetbek Dzhumadylov, Kaliycha Rysmendieva, Asanbek Kydyrnazarov

metadata.Plot: Soviet Union, near the Chinese border, 1923. A stranger has just come in this little country village. He is a teacher, sent by the Communist Party to teach the ignorant masses. But the countrymen are to help him, and even to let their children go and "sleep" at school instead of giving a hand. There is only, Altynai, an orphan, to seem fascinated by the teacher and his knowledge.
metadata.Writer: Chingiz Aitmatov, Boris Dobrodeyev, Andrey Konchalovskiy
metadata.Actors: Bolot Beyshenaliev, Natalya Arinbasarova, Idris Nogajbayev
